title: [K-12] Inclusive Digital Learning Environment Design Competency Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and elementary-level understanding of social education fields
context.additional_context: Blended Instructional Environment Design Considering Multicultural Learners and Those with Digital Accessibility Needs

learning_goals: Using collaborative learning platforms, learners can design effective interaction strategies among peers with diverse cultural backgrounds.

Learners propose ≥2 content adaptation strategies (text difficulty adjustment, subtitles/audio options, time allocation plans) for three virtual learner profiles (differing language, accessibility, pace) using adaptive learning technologies (AI recommendation systems, multilingual tools). The plan must meet ≥4 of 5 teacher rubric items.

Learners develop an inclusive digital learning scenario reflecting ≥3 diversity factors (cultural background, language proficiency, learning style) over 2–4 weeks. The scenario must include ≥2 multimodal resources (video, image, audio) with bilingual subtitles (e.g., English/Korean) and achieve "excellent" in ≥4 of 5 peer review rubric items.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
